content.prompt: Which of the following best explains why the use of surveys to ask participants about implicit attitudes would be beneficial from an ethical perspective?

choices.label: Surveys allow researchers to forgo informed consent before starting a study.
Surveys allow researchers to forgo debriefing participants after a study is complete.
Surveys prevent participants from consciously having to express undesirable emotions and cognitions.
Surveys prevent participants understanding the purpose of the research study they are participating in.

skill.text: 2.D: Evaluate whether a psychological research scenario followed appropriate ethical procedures.
